data.title: Simple calculator
data.statement:
You have to do successive easy calculations, like on a calculator, with integer numbers.
No priority, no parenthesis, only {{ADD}}, {{SUB}}, {{MULT}} and {{DIVBY}} which represent addition, substraction, multiplication and division respectively.
You have to truncate the result of the division, i. e. round to the integer closer to 0: 5/3=1, -5/3=-1 ...

testCases.title: Everything
testCases.testIn:
999
12
MULT 0
ADD -10
DIVBY -3
ADD 248
DIVBY 5
MULT 5
SUB -12
ADD 0
MULT -4
ADD -1000
SUB 4096
DIVBY -6

testCases.title: Everything
testCases.testIn:
12345678
12
ADD -8
SUB 70
ADD -600
SUB 5000
DIVBY 10000
SUB 234
SUB -1000
DIVBY -3
ADD -111
MULT -1
DIVBY 100
SUB -35

testCases.title: Integer DIV and step by step
Integer DIV and step by step

data.constraints:
[[linesNum]] >= 0
To be compatible with reverse mode, there is no trap :
- all numbers (inputs, intermediate or output) are 32 bits signed
- there is no {{DIVBY 0}}
data.stubGenerator:
read startNum:int
read linesNum:int
loop linesNum read calc:word(9) n:int
write result
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> The number [[startNum]] you start with
<<Second line:>> The number [[linesNum]] of lines to read
<<[[linesNum]] following lines:>> The calculations to do, composed of a string [[calc]] (can be {{ADD}}, {{SUB}}, {{MULT}} or {{DIVBY}}) and an integer [[n]], space separated.
data.outputDescription: A number [[result]], the result of successive calculations.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to do successive easy calculations, like on a calculator, with integer numbers.
No priority, no parenthesis, only ADD, SUB, MULT and DIVBY which represent addition, substraction, multiplication and division respectively.
You have to truncate the result of the division, i. e. round to the integer closer to 0: 5/3=1, -5/3=-1 ...
Input
First line: The number startNum you start with
Second line: The number linesNum of lines to read
linesNum following lines: The calculations to do, composed of a string calc (can be ADD, SUB, MULT or DIVBY) and an integer n, space separated.
Output
A number result, the result of successive calculations.
Constraints
linesNum >= 0
To be compatible with reverse mode, there is no trap :
- all numbers (inputs, intermediate or output) are 32 bits signed
- there is no DIVBY 0
Example
Input
-10
2
ADD 25
ADD 3
Output
18
